alert.note: Alert for Modoc County; North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued September 19 at 1:10PM PDT until September 21 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Freezing and sub-freezing temperatures generally between 27 and 32 degrees. * WHERE...In California, North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County, Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties and Modoc County. In Oregon, Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades, Klamath Basin, Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County and Central and Eastern Lake County. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Modoc County; North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
